reviewText: Have you ever wondered why attorneys at trial or deposition are never put under oath?  Corollary question:  how can you tell when a lawyer is lying?  This is a story which is quite on point regarding legal ethics or lack thereof.  The concept is fine and deserving of broader discussion--ie, when a trial about a murdered man is made out to be (by the defense attorney) a trial of the decedent's homosexuality.  Although it should be obvious that a person's sexual preference does not have anything to do with the fact that a murder can be excused because of it.  The actors were good, tho not great.  This movie somehow did not generate the tension that a "grade A" picture should possess.  Therefore, "Final Justice", although posing some interesting ethical problems, is a "B movie"---not bad, but yet missing the mark.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: A fitting title for this movie. An arrogant sleezy lawyer got caught with his hand in the cookie jar and the kidnapper got her just deserts. But so much in this movie was overlooked, surely no real police force, prosecutor didn't do his job in the trial and lots was left to your imagination. It did hold your interest and had some funny scenes which lightened the mood somewhat but all around the characters were rather off, the kidnapper too layed back, the lawyer not even trying to overpower the woman although he is twice her size, kinda like he's not all there even though he gets all bent out of shape, so he's all bark and no bite.
summary: It did hold your interest and had some funny scenes which lightened the mood somewhat but all around ...
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: I completely enjoyed this movie.  I would recommend this movie to friends and family - enjoy.  Will probably watch again
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: Oh, Annette O'Toole makes it all believable and real. She is a wonderful actress and is supported by other very good actors. This is a twist to the corrupt attorneys getting the bad guy off. However, this script makes it work.  The filming and directing is top notch. The twists and turns of the story cannot be anticipated, but serve the story and "justice" very well.  It is a keeper.  I've watched it three times now and I'm not tired of it yet.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: I really enjoyed this one.  I especially liked that it had a great message in it... what goes around comes around.  Very well done and interesting.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: Being a former law student and continuously involved in studysing aspects of the legal system, I find this film, though fictional, captivating for several reasons.  Not the least of which, is how skewed toward those with property and money it has become!.  Having the power to influence decisions has taken Justice out of all court proceedings and made a mockery of the Jurisprudence System.  Every State Dept. of Corrections level of law enforcement has made inappropriate and legally binding decisions through our errant precedent setting system fallible and just plain wrong.  People today without money or property are urged by court appointed attorneys normally Public Defenders to urge their clients to plead guilty and enter into a faulty and disgusting deceitful apparatus full of chicanery, artifice, and deception.  This film highlights the process by which this system is perped on an unsuspecting public who could care less what happens to the lower end of the economic spectrum.  That's why so many Capital Cases have been reversed once the suppressed "real evidence" is opened for a full airing of the facts rather than the plea bargain agreements leading to a conviction of an innocent party often placing them on death row!!
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: If you love Annette, you'll love this movie. She is awesome in it. If you don't love her, it is still a great movie. If you've ever secretely dreamed of getting revenge, then dream on. I love it when she makes him.... ah "wet himself". I laughed till I cried. Oh by the way, she later married the creep in real life.This is one of Annette's better movies.
summary: Annette O'Toole SHINES in this movie!

reviewText: If Hollywood needs to make a pro-this or pro-that movie, more power to them. All I ask is that they make said movie realistic and enjoyable. This is a long PSA in favor of homosexuality. I have to believe, based on the generic blandness of this movie, not to mention the lack of realism in events and dialogue and the poor acting, that event the most ardent gay supporter blushed with embarrassment. I have seen middle school plays that had better acting and were more authentic. Nothing about the short bit I watched was remotely realistic. Annette O'Toole is as frumpy a school marm as they come, and Lenny as a Lawyer? Implausible!The better name for this should have been Horrid Putrid.
summary: After about 10 Mins. I had to leave it. Boring at best.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: Taut legal thriller  about a major flaw in the legal system and one woman's vendetta to rectify a wrong done to her family. Fast paced and credible script. The action is nuanced and the total is well directed. Annette O'toole was allowed to show the range of her considerable acting skills.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: Merle Hammond, (Michael McKean) a sleazy attorney uses corrupt tactics and convinces a jury to acquit his client who is a killer. Gwen, the murdered victim's sister, (Annette O' Toole) knows the real truth and plots revenge against the attorney.Out of desperation, she kidnaps the attorney in an attempt to make him confess to his unscrupulous him confess to his unscrupulous tactics. The cards twist when he escapes and puts her on trial for his kidnapping.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: There is a certain satisfaction when the "bad guy" gets his own and this movie does that in a tasteful manner.  I'm a big fan of Annette and she certainly shines in this venue. As another reviewer stated it is good to see Dennis in a serious role...he does make a good "bad guy" without fitting any stereotype per se. It is a good illustration of how ruthless people can take advantage of our jury system and victimize the victim even further for the sake of winning.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: This older movie that was just released is an exciting drama that kept us on the edge of our seats through the whole thing.
Title: Final Justice

reviewText: I loved this movie.  Finally, these super lawyers are victims themselves. This gave a lot of insight into what theses high powered lawyers think of juries.
Title: Final Justice
